entries.journal_entry_completion_summary: While this started as a stolen property case, in the end it was revealed to be a murder. Lt. Col. Wilfred Quelsh murdered Kal Braggan to stop Kal from revealing that he was once a CorSec officer who was framed for taking money from smugglers by Lt. Col. Quelsh. Kal Braggan had been discharged from CorSec and sent to prison. Lt. Col. Wilfred Quelsh was promoted and awarded the Corellian Medal of Honor for what was belived to be the removal of corruption in the Corellian Security Forces.
entries.journal_entry_description: Some thieves have stolen the Corellian Medal of Honor from a retired CorSec officer. Recover the medal and bring down the thieves.
entries.task00_journal_entry_description: Speak with Lt. Col. Wilfred Quelsh about his stolen Corellian Medal of Honor.
entries.task01_journal_entry_description: Speak with Edbr Yamagh, aide to Lt. Col. Quelsh. Find out if he saw anything.
entries.task02_journal_entry_description: Defeat some of Braggan's Fist thugs and find out what they know about Lt. Col. Quelsh's medal. They are often found in the slums area of town.
entries.task03_journal_entry_description: The thugs claim to know nothing, but they let slip that their leader, Kal Braggan, has been acting odd of late and has disappeared. They also reveal the location of their main camp.
entries.task03_message_box_text: The thugs claim to know nothing, but they let slip that their leader, Kal Braggan, has been acting odd of late and has disappeared. They also reveal the location of their main camp.
entries.task04_journal_entry_description: Search the camp of the Braggan's Fist thugs and find some clue as to what is going on with their leader. With any luck, it will have something to do with the missing medal.
entries.task05_journal_entry_description: Kal Braggan's datapad reveals that the leader was scared of something or someone, it also mentions that Kal has gone into hiding. He left directions to his hiding place, in case his thugs need to find him.
entries.task05_message_box_text: Kal Braggan's datapad reveals that Kal has gone into hiding, though it does not say why. He left directions to his hiding place for his thugs, in case they need to find him. There is also an entry with the name Wilfred Quelsh, but it looks like most of that entry was recently deleted.
entries.task06_journal_entry_description: Kal Braggan's datapad gave you Kal's hiding place. Go there and speak with Kal. Find out what his connection is to Lt. Col. Quelsh.
entries.task07_item_name: You found Lt. Col. Quelsh's medal as well as a journal belonging to Kal Braggan
entries.task07_journal_entry_description: Search Kal Braggan's hiding place for any clues as to what happened to him.
entries.task07_retrieve_menu_text: Pick up the Medal of Honor
entries.task08_journal_entry_description: Upon opening Kal Braggan's journal, you find that the thug leader was working on a story of his past when he was a CorSec officer. He tells of a time when he was betrayed by a fellow officer. He was accused of taking money from smugglers in exchange for looking the other way as those smugglers brought illegal goods to Corellia. Kal Braggan was convicted, discharged from CorSec, and sent to prison for a number of years. Kal goes on to reveal proof that he was framed, and that the officer who set him up was the one taking money from the smugglers. That officer was awarded the Corellian Medal of Honor for his fight against corruption within CorSec. His name was Wilfred Quelsh.
entries.task08_message_box_text: Upon opening Kal Braggan's journal, you find that the thug leader was working on a story of his past when he was a CorSec officer. He tells of a time when he was betrayed by a fellow officer. He was accused of taking money from smugglers in exchange for looking the other way as those smugglers brought illegal goods to Corellia. Kal Braggan was convicted, discharged from CorSec, and sent to prison for a number of years. Kal goes on to reveal proof that he was framed, and that the officer who set him up was the one taking money from the smugglers. That officer was awarded the Corellian Medal of Honor for his fight against corruption within CorSec. His name was Wilfred Quelsh.
entries.task09_journal_entry_description: Confront Lt. Col. Wilfred Quelsh with the things you have learned.
entries.task10_journal_entry_description: Report to Major Walden and brief her on your findings.
